awards.description: THE WORK TO BE ACCOMPLISHED INCLUDES THREE WORK PLAN COMPONENTS: BUILDS TRIBAL ADMINISTRATIVE CAPACITY AND SUPPORTS TRAVEL TO ENVIRONMENTAL CONFERENCES; RESPONDS TO LOCAL CLIMATE CHANGE AND EROSION CONCERNS; SUPPORTS A TRIBAL SOLID AND HAZARDOUS WASTE AND RECYCLING PROGRAM.

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS FOR THE NATIVE VILLAGE OF EKUK TO MANAGE THE ENVIRONMENTAL OFFICE AND PERFORM ADMINISTRATIVE TASKS; DEVELOP A CLIMATE ADAPTATION PLAN AND PERFORM SHORELINE EROSION MONITORING; COORDINATE OUTREACH ON TRADITIONAL/HEALTHY FOODS WITHIN THE COMMUNITY; AND SOLID WASTE MANAGEMENT AND PLANNING FOR NEW LAND FILL DEVELOPMENT. ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED ARE TO DEVELOP BETTER ORGANIZATION, REPORTING AND JOB TRAINING FOR THE ENVIRONMENTAL OFFICE; COORDINATE EROSION MONITORING AND PLANNING OF EROSION PROTECTION WITH PARTNERS; UNDERSTAND TRADITIONAL HEALTHY FOODS THAT TRIBAL MEMBERS AND ELDERS GREW UP WITH AND TO UNDERSTAND TRIBAL YOUTHS KNOWLEDGE OF THESE FOODS; WORK ON OUTREACH TO THE COMMUNITY ON PROPER DISPOSAL OF WASTE AND WORK WITH CLARKS POINT AND EKUK TRIBE TO PLAN LANDFILL.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE EXPECTED OUTCOME IS TO HAVE AN ENVIRONMENTAL OFFICE THAT IS ORGANIZED AND MEETING THE ENVIRONMENTAL GOALS OF THE TRIBE FROM YEAR TO YEAR; DEVELOPING PLANS OVER TIME TO ADAPT AND STRENGTHEN THE COMMUNITY THROUGH CLIMATE CHANGE RESILIENCY; AN UNDERSTANDING OF WHAT IS CHANGING WITH TRADITIONAL HEALTHY FOODS DUE TO CLIMATE CHANGE AND COME UP WITH PLANS TO ADAPT TO THE CHANGES; AND A SOLID WASTE PROGRAM THAT KEEPS EKUK VILLAGE CLEAN. THE BENEFICIARIES OF THIS WORK WILL BE THE VILLAGE MEMBERS OF EKUK.
